meanings.sent1: She dissimilates her outfit by wearing mismatched socks.
meanings.sent2: The twins dissimilate each other by choosing different hobbies.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon dissimilates itself to blend in with various backgrounds.
meanings.sent4: His new haircut dissimilates him from his usual appearance.
meanings.sent5: The artist dissimilates colors to create a unique painting.

meanings.sent1: He dissimilates between right and wrong easily.
meanings.sent2: The detective dissimilates the real clues from the fake ones.
meanings.sent3: The teacher dissimilates the identical twins by their handwriting.
meanings.sent4: Her keen eye can dissimilate the smallest details in a painting.
meanings.sent5: The expert can dissimilate authentic products from counterfeits.

meanings.definition: To change or alter in appearance or nature.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar dissimilates into a butterfly through metamorphosis.
meanings.sent2: The magic potion dissimilates the appearance of the old man.
meanings.sent3: The wizard dissimilates the frog into a prince with a spell.
meanings.sent4: Time can slowly dissimilate the landscape into something unrecognizable.
meanings.sent5: The storm dissimilates the calm sea into turbulent waves.
